戴.definition: to put on or wear (glasses, hat, gloves etc); to respect; to bear; to support

戴勝.definition: (bird species of China) Eurasian hoopoe (Upupa epops)

戴奧辛.definition: dioxin, carcinogenic heterocyclic hydrocarbon (esp. Taiwan usage)

戴孝.definition: to wear mourning garb; to be in mourning

戴帽子.definition: to wear a hat; (fig.) to stigmatize; to be branded as

戴月披星.definition: see 披星戴月[pi1 xing1 dai4 yue4]

戴有色眼鏡.definition: to wear colored glasses; to have a prejudiced viewpoint

戴盆望天.definition: lit. viewing the sky with a basin on one's head; it is hard to get a clear view of the sky while carrying a platter on one's head; fig. it is hard to get on in one's career while encumbered by family obligations; one can't perform a major task while bothered by other duties

戴秉國.definition: Dai Bingguo (1941-), a Chinese politician and professional diplomat

戴綠帽子.definition: to have been cheated on by one's partner (formerly meant "to be a cuckold", i.e. applied to men only)

戴綠頭巾.definition: see 戴綠帽子|戴绿帽子[dai4 lu:4 mao4 zi5]

戴錶.definition: to wear a watch; homophone for 代表[dai4 biao3] used to avoid Internet censorship in the PRC

戴高帽子.definition: (coll.) to be the object of flattery; to be placed on a pedestal

戴高樂.definition: Charles De Gaulle (1890-1970), French general and politician, leader of the Free French during World War II and president of the Republic 1959-1969
